document.heading: District of Columbia Commission on Baseball Act of 1991

history.narrative: Law 9-54, the “District of Columbia Commission on Baseball Act of 1991,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-112, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 2, 1991, and October 1, 1991, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 23, 1991, it was assigned Act No. 9-96 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
Expiration Section 9(b) of D.C. Law 9-54 provided that the act shall expire 2 years after Dec. 10, 1991. D.C. Law 9-54 enacted former §§ 2-2909 through 2-2915 [§§ 3209 through 3-3215, 2001 Ed.].

ACT 9-96 Enrolled Original Codlfl e tion Di tri of Columbia Code t’ 1,99,2 Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA OCTOBER 23, 1991 To establish the District of Columbia Commission on Baseball. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Commission on Baseball Act of 1991 See. 2. Establishment a) There is established a Commission on Baseball Commission b) The Commission shall assist and advise the Council regarding the establishment of a professional baseball team in the District of Columbia District and on the participation by residents in amateur baseball. See. 3. Composition; vacancies; quorum; meetings a) The Commission shall consist of 17 members. The Mayor shall appoint 9 members, including a chairperson. The remaining 8 members shall be appointed by the Chairman of the Committee on Public Services. Nonresidents of the District may be appointed to the Commission b) A vacancy on the Commission shall be filled in the same manner that the original appointment was made c) A majority of the members of the Commission shall constitute a quorum. A quorum shall be necessary for the Commission to conduct its business d) The Chairperson shall determine the place, time, and frequency of Commission meetings. The Council may convene the Commission at any time. See. 4. Compensation. Members of the Commission shall receive no compensation, but may be reimbursed for actual expenses incurred in the performance of official duties, pursuant to rules issued by the Mayor in accordance with section 1108 of the District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978, effective March 3, 1979 (D.C. Law 2-139; D.C. Code §1-612.8 Sec. 5. Employment of consultant. The Commission may employ a consultant to advise and assist the Commission in performing its functions. Note, Section 2-2901 Original See. 6. Comprehensive report. The Commission shall submit to the Council a comprehensive report which summarizes the activities and findings of the Commission and contains specific recommendations regarding the establishment of a professional baseball team and on the participation of residents in amateur baseball. Sec. 7. Appropriations; grants; gifts and donations a) There may be appropriated out of revenues available to the District sums necessary to carry out the purposes of this act b) The Commission is authorized to apply for and receive grants to fund its activities c) The Commission may solicit and accept private gifts and donations to carry out the purposes of this act. See. 8. Baseball fund a) A District of Columbia Commission on Baseball Fund Fund shall be established by the Commission to receive all money from whatever source derived. All money generated by this Commission shall be deposited in the Fund, in coordination with the District of Columbia Comptroller b) Any money of the Commission, from whatever source derived, shall be for the sole use of the Commission and shall be deposited as soon as practicable in the Fund c) The Commission shall submit to the Mayor and to the Council a monthly statement of its receipts and disbursements from the Fund d) Upon the expiration of this act and after all obligations of the Commission have been satisfied, any money remaining in the Fund shall be paid over into the General Fund of the District as general purpose revenue s e) Any funds remaining from the Commission on Baseball Fund established by section 9 of the District of Columbia Commission on Baseball Act of 1984, effective March 13, 1985 D.C. Law 5-143; D.C. Code §2-2908) shall be deposited in the fund established by this section. Sec. 9. Effective date; sunset provision a) This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C. Code §1-233(c)(1 and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations.
